title: Tom Stoppard - Plays, Adaptations and a Novel (15 books)
description:
SIR TOM STOPPARD (b. 1937) is a Czech-born British playwright who has written prolifically for TV, radio, film and stage.  He has been a key playwright of the National Theatre and is one of the most internationally performed dramatists of his generation.  His two great stage successes were ROSENCRANTZ AND GUILDENSTERN ARE DEAD (1966) and THE REAL THING (1982), and he reached an even wider audience -- and won an Academy Award -- for his screenplay for the 1998 film SHAKESPEARE IN LOVE.  He has won 4 Tony Awards.  Themes of human rights, censorship and political freedom pervade his work along with exploration of linguistics and philosophy.


The following books are a mix of ePUB and PDF formats:

* ARCADIA (Faber & Faber, 1993) -- ePUB + PDF

* THE COAST OF UTOPIA: Part II. Shipwreck (Grove, 2003) -- ePUB

* THE DOG IT WAS THAT DIED & OTHER PLAYS (Faber & Faber, 1993) -- PDF

* JUMPERS (Grove, 1972) -- ePUB

* LORD MALQUIST AND MR. MOON (Grove, 2005) -- ePUB

* ON THE RAZZLE (Samuel French, 1982) -- PDF

* PIRANDELLO'S HENRY IV (Grove, 2004) -- ePUB

* THE REAL INSPECTOR HOUND & OTHER PLAYS (Grove, 1998) -- ePUB

* THE REAL THING (Faber & FAber, 1983) -- PDF

* ROCK 'N' ROLL (Grove, 2006) -- ePUB

* ROSENCRANTZ AND GUILDENSTERN ARE DEAD (Grove, 1967) -- PDF

* ROUGH CROSSING: Freely Adapted from Ferenc Molnar's Play at the Castle (Faber & Faber, 1985) -- PDF

* SHAKESPEARE IN LOVE: A Screenplay [with Marc Norman] (Hyperion, 1998) -- PDF

* SQUARING THE CIRCLE (Faber & Faber, 1984) -- PDF

* TRAVESTIES (Grove, 1975) -- ePUB
